result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 2:04 PM Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Gilbert F. Steffanides.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the Court regarding restitution request. ADA Ryan advises that no restitution will be further pursued. No objection by Atty Zamzow. Based on the agreement by both parties, the Court sets the amount of restitution owed by the Defendant at $0.00.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 9:58 AM Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Gilbert F. Steffanides.  Attorney Wesley J Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended information stated. No objection to it's filing by the defendant. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 2 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 1 - DRI.  No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation consecutive to any existing sentence - Conditions - Restitution in an amount to be determined at a hearing to be held within 60 days, Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given. Defendant to appear for the restitution hearing by Zoom from the institution.
Restitution hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Restitution hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Restitution Summary - $1,890.00

20CF185 & 22CF24 Cases called @ 12:02 PM Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides appeared in court, in custody with Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow. Attorney Heywood appears telephonically. Attorney Wesley J Kottke appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF24 - Officer Justin Jackson sworn in for testimony. Direct exam by ADA Kottke. Witness identifies the defendant. Exhibits 1 & 2 marked. Witness testifies to exhibits 1 & 2. ADA Kottke offers exhibits 1 & 2. The Court receives exhibits 1 & 2. Cross exam by Atty Zamzow. Witness excused. Evidence closed. The Court finds probable cause. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant stands mute. NG plea entered by the Court. 20CF185 - The Court makes note of a previous NGI plea that was entered that was not withdrawn. Atty Heywood advises that the defendant withdraws the NGI plea but still maintains the NG plea. The Court questions the DE regarding the withdrawal of the NGI plea - DE concurs. The Court finds that the defendant has withdrawn the NGI plea but still maintains the NG plea. The parties are requesting a STC in approximately 30 days with a follow up SEH/P/S hearing.
Status conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. Bond argument by ADA Ryan.
